alert.note: Alert for Adams; Buffalo; Hall; Kearney (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 18 at 8:12PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Adams, northeastern Kearney, southeastern Buffalo and southwestern Hall Counties through 845 PM CDT... At 812 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Minden, or 13 miles southeast of Kearney, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Heartwell around 820 PM CDT. Kenesaw around 830 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Shelton, Prosser and Wood River. This includes Interstate 80 between mile markers 283 and 303. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
